Job/Team Function: To lead the development of the Environment Agency and Met Office Joint Forecasting Centre. This is a new role setting up a joint flood and weather forecasting unit to help improve flood forecasting and warning techniques and lead in discussions with Central Government on the future management of flood and natural hazard forecasting for the UK. The centre will be similar to approaches taken in France and Sweden and is being developed to fulfil the Pitt inquiry recommendation on flood and weather forecasting. This role is seen as vital in the development of a strategic partnership and whilst initially for 12 months, is likely to lead to the setting up of a permanent joint team.
Parent Department: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs
Unit: Head Office - National Operations - Flood Forecasting Centre

Job Title: Head of Function - Environment and Business
Job/Team Function: The revised Bathing Waters Directive (rBWD) is a major directive entering its implementation phase. Around 70 bathing waters are at risk of failing the revised directive in 2015, which is a significant challenge and risk to the reputation of the Environment Agency and government. The rBWD requires improvements in public information on bathing water quality, so the team also works closely with communications colleagues and those in the Evidence Directorate. Media interest is high and must be carefully handled. The team advises and supports Defra and the Welsh Assembly Government in developing policies for implementing the revised directive. It works in close partnership with water companies, local authority groups and farming organisations to drive improvements in bathing water quality.
Parent Department: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs
Unit: Head Office - Environment and Business - Bathing Waters

Job Title: Head of Function - Environment and Business
Job/Team Function: The Sustainable Places team leads on issues relating to housing, planning and local government that contribute to cross cutting outcomes for both E&B and FCRM. Its key priorities are: Steer and support Operations to work in partnership with local authorities and local communities to deliver: Better local environments that enhance people�s lives and support a sustainable economy. New and existing developments that have a reduced environmental impact and well planned environmental infrastructure. Spatial and economic planning that meets environmental standards and objectives, and addresses climate change, in order to improve the quality of places for people. Respond to the Government�s Localism agenda and rapid reform of the planning and delivery landscape, by developing new ways of working and a culture shift that redefines our relationship with local government, neighbourhoods and communities so that we can work better in partnership to deliver local environmental outcomes. Responding to the Arms Length Body Review that places greater emphasis on joining up across the Defra family and implementing the review of our planning and development control functions and responding to changes to national, sub-national and local planning.
Parent Department: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs
Unit: Head Office - Environment and Business - Climate Change and Communities - Sustainable Places

Name: Ian Barker
Job/Team Function: Bringing together water, land, fisheries and biodiversity has created the opportunity for more efficient and integrated delivery of environmental objectives. This group focuses on improving the environment for wildlife to flourish and people to enjoy. The teams are also responsible for ensuring that there is enough water of the right quality, to meet the needs of society and the economy. Water and Land are inextricably linked. For example, the protection of bathing waters requires as much attention to land and rivers as it does to beaches and foreshores. Ensuring there are healthy rivers rich with diverse life means working closely with farmers to make certain they are managing their land in ways which safeguard the soil and the water which drains through and from it.
